CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1944, pg. 4, reads: "Dewey Meets Pittsburgh Leaders - Gov. Thomas E. Dewey of New York, Presidential candidate of the Republican party, met with Negro leaders of Allegheny County last Friday and pledged an administration that will give 'equality of opportunity and justice to all our citizens' during a session at the William Penn hotel preceding his major address here. Ira F. Lewis, president of the Pittsburgh Courier, acted as spokesman for the group. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men, including presidential candidate Thomas E. Dewey wearing double-breasted suit, and Ira F. Lewis near center, standing in William Penn Hotel
